items.title: The Off-The-Record Response Header Field
items.desc: IETF proposal for a HTTP response header field that enables a server to inform the client that the requested website should be treated as 'off-the-record.'  The purpose is to indicate that the server considers the content sensitive in some way, and the client may choose not to retain any record of accessing it.

items.title: STAR: Distributed Secret Sharing for Private Threshold Aggregation Reporting
items.desc: IETF spec proposal for a cryptographic system for a high performance, low trust system form enforcing k-anonymity protections.

items.title: W3C Security and Privacy Questionnaire
items.desc: W3C guidance document for specification authors, on how to identify and mitigate privacy and security risks in Web standards proposals.

items.title: Global Privacy Control (GPC)
items.desc: Proposed spec to allow browser users to assert legal privacy rights in a privacy preserving manner.

items.title: Improving Web Privacy And Security with a Cost-Benefit Analysis of the Web API
items.desc: My thesis, presenting a thorough measurement of WebAPI use, and ways those findings can be used to better protect the privacy and security of web users. Written for the completion of my PhD.

items.title: Yao's Garbled Circuits: Recent Directions and Implementations
items.desc: Literature review of performance and security developments in using Yao's Protocol for secure function evaluation. Written for my degree's "Written Critique and Presentation" requirement.
